definition: male/Baron, lowest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/CL:個|个[ge4]

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
Han ethnic group/Chinese (language)/the Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)

pinyin: nan2 zi3 han4 da4 zhang4 fu5

sentences.english: The spring of pure Colombian husband, real men hemosiderosis .
sentences.chinese: 春季纯哥伦比亚丈夫，真正的男子汉含铁血。

sentences.english: How many man anger are the young people, how many ingredient flew the swallow with Lin Niao.
sentences.chinese: 多少男子汉一怒为红颜，多少同林鸟已成分飞燕。

sentences.english: Military sevice will make a man out of you .
sentences.chinese: 服兵役会把你锻炼也一个男子汉。

sentences.english: I will be a love says risible young man tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 明天我又是一个爱说爱笑的小男子汉。

sentences.english: A real man somtimes will demonstrates his manly disposition.
sentences.chinese: 真正的男子汉总要展现粗犷的一面。

sentences.english: It’s as if these young men have developed a warped idea of manhood.
sentences.chinese: 似乎这些年轻小伙子们对男子汉气概有歪曲的理解。

sentences.english: He was a handsome man still, kathleen adored him .
sentences.chinese: 他仍然是一个仪表堂堂的男子汉，受到凯丝琳的崇拜。

sentences.english: My father, he is a man, and at least he did some racing.
sentences.chinese: 我的父亲，他是一个男子汉，至少他开过赛车。

sentences.english: Battle is the most magnificent competition in which a human being can indulge.
sentences.chinese: 战斗是不甘居人下的男子汉最能表现自己胆量的竞争。

sentences.english: It takes a strong man to cry. Jesus wept, and He was the manliest Man that ever lived.
sentences.chinese: 一个男子汉哭泣是无碍于一个人的强毅。

sentences.english: He faced up to his difficulties manfully.
sentences.chinese: 他以男子汉的气概勇敢地面对困难。

sentences.english: A man should not depend on others for financial aid.
sentences.chinese: 男子汉不应靠别人提供经济援助。

sentences.english: It was also true that I wanted to show off my new manliness.
sentences.chinese: 我想表现出全新的男子汉气概，这也是真的。

sentences.english: How many roads must a man walks down you will call him man?
sentences.chinese: 一个男人究竟要走多少路你才能叫他男子汉？

sentences.english: And then the world will know the hoochie coochie man.
sentences.chinese: 然后世界将会认识男子汉。

definition: lit. able to support both heaven and earth/of indomitable spirit (idiom)
daring to act and courageous enough to take responsibility for it/a true man has the courage to accept the consequences of his actions/the buck stops here
variant of 敢做敢當|敢做敢当[gan3 zuo4 gan3 dang1]
very masculine guy/a real man/(used ironically) a grown man
menfolk (collective term for men of different generations)/husbands and their fathers etc
a manly man/a man of character
real men do not easily cry (idiom)
pinyin: nan2 er2 you3 lei4 bu4 qing1 tan2
